p: A high consensus among 13 future climate models shows that P. parlatorei will experience an overall range squeeze of its currently occupied total area due to combined drying/warming trends that prevent the opening of new suitable areas for the species, thus substantially threatening the persistence of the species as a whole. Given that loss of native forest is a key conservation concern globally, urgent measures are needed to conserve P. parlatorei in order to preserve the ecosystem services that such a unique conifer provides in montane forests along the subtropical Andes.
